intro: Saccolabium micranthum, commonly known as the small-flowered saccolabium, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Leguminosae, also known as the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its nitrogen-fixing ability. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers that are typically pale yellow to brown in color. Its leaves are compound, consisting of several small leaflets, and it has a woody stem that becomes more branched with age. Saccolabium micranthum is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to survive in low-water environments.
